thread.title: NFL Week 4 injuries: Lynch out Monday
thread.title_full: NFL Week 4 injuries: Lynch out Monday

author: USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY
title: NFL Week 4 injuries: Lynch out Monday
text:
NFL Week 4 injuries: Lynch out Monday USA Today Sports 3 hrs ago by USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY © Joe Nicholson, USA TODAY Sports Joe Nicholson, USA TODAY Sports There will be no Beast Mode in prime time this week.
AdChoices Seattle Seahawks running back Marshawn lynch has been ruled out of Monday's game against the Detroit Lions with a hamstring injury.
Undrafted rookie Thomas Rawls, who rushed for 104 yards last week against the Chicago Bears, is Lynch's likely replacement in the starting lineup.
Here are the other notable injuries throughout the NFL on Sunday:
— Philadelphia Eagles cornerback Byron Maxwell (quad), offensive tackle Jason Peters (quad) and linebacker Mychal Hendricks all left Sunday's game against the Washington Redskins and did not return.
— Miami Dolphins cornerback Brent Grimes left Sunday's game against the New York Jets with a knee injury.
— St. Louis Rams linebacker Alec Ogletree was carted off the field with a leg injury during the game against the Arizona Cardinals.
— San Diego Chargers cornerback Brandon Flowers suffered a concussion against the Cleveland Browns and did not return.
